edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.metric
Class Measurement

java.lang.Object
  edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.metric.Measurement
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Measurement
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Represents a single scalar measurement made based on the quantification of an image.

Author:
Colin J. Fuller
See Also:

Constructor Detail

Measurement

public Measurement()
Creates a new, empty measurement.

Measurement

public Measurement(boolean hasFeature,
                   long id,
                   double measurement,
                   java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String type,
                   java.lang.String image)
Creates a new measurement with all information supplied.

Parameters:
hasFeature - Indicates whether this measurement is associated with a particular image feature.
id - Indicates with which feature this measurement is associated.
measurement - The value of the measurement.
name - A string naming what the measurement is.
type - A string indicating what type of measurement this is (e.g. "intensity" or "size").
image - A string naming the image on which the measurement was made.
Method Detail

hasAssociatedFeature

public boolean hasAssociatedFeature()
Checks whether a feature is associated with this measurement.

Returns:
true if this measurement has a feature, false otherwise.

setHasAssociatedFeature

public void setHasAssociatedFeature(boolean hasAssociatedFeature)
Sets whether a feature is associated with this measurement.

Parameters:
hasAssociatedFeature - a boolean saying whether the measurement has a feature.

getFeatureID

public long getFeatureID()
Gets the ID of any associated feature.

Returns:
the ID of the associated feature, which may not be meaningful if there is no associated feature.

setFeatureID

public void setFeatureID(long featureID)
Sets the ID of any associated feature.

This does not change whether there is a feature associated with the measurement.

Parameters:
featureID - a long specifying the ID of the feature.

getMeasurement

public double getMeasurement()
Gets the value of the measurement.

Returns:
the measurement

setMeasurement

public void setMeasurement(double measurement)
Sets the value of the measurement.

Parameters:
measurement - the measurement value to set

getMeasurementName

public java.lang.String getMeasurementName()
Gets the name of this measurement.

Returns:
a string with the name of the measurement.

setMeasurementName

public void setMeasurementName(java.lang.String measurementName)
Sets the name of this measurement.

Parameters:
measurementName - a String containing the name of the measurement.

getMeasurementType

public java.lang.String getMeasurementType()
Gets the type of this measurement.

Returns:
a string containing the type of the measurement.

setMeasurementType

public void setMeasurementType(java.lang.String measurementType)
Sets the type of this measurement.

Parameters:
measurementType - a String naming the type of the measurement (e.g. "intensity" or "size").

getImageID

public java.lang.String getImageID()
Gets a string naming the image on which the measurement was made.

Returns:
a string containing information on the image. This will likely be the path to the image.

setImageID

public void setImageID(java.lang.String imageID)
Sets a string naming the image on which the measurement was made.

Parameters:
imageID - a string containing information on the image; this should probably be the path to the image, where applicable.
